general_advisory: To minimise the cold wave effect or chilling injury, light and frequent irrigation through sprinkler can be provided. Aphids and other sucking pest incidence will increase on the crop. Regularly have a watch and spray pesticides as per requirement. Cover the small crops with polythene during the night hours.

advisory: Irrigate the field if soil is getting dry.
Remove weeds from the field and keep it clean.
Cutworm infestation may be seen in the field. Cutworm in Chickpea can be managed by spraying Methyl Parathion @ 1 ml/lt.
Remove weeds and monitor the field for any pests and diseases.
The incidence of aphids along with mustard saw fly larva and adult may be seen in the field. Spray Emamectin benzoate 4% SG @ 5g/10lt of water.
Powdery mildew in linseed can be reduced by spraying wettable sulphur @ 3% or Karathane @ 2g/lt.
Provide light irrigation to the crop.
Keep the root zone clean and remove weeds.
If wilting is seen in the field, drench Blitox - 50 @ 45g + Steptocycline @ 2g in 10lts of water.
Little leaf in Chilli can be seen the field. If that happens spray Dimethoate @ 2 ml/lt.
Aphids and Jassids infestation may be seen the field. To manage it spray Imidachloprid 17.8% SL @ 1 ml/lt.
To minimise the infestation of aphids and jassids in tomato crop, spray dimethoate or Imidachloprid @ 1 ml/lt.
Fruit and shoot borer in tomato plants can be managed by spraying Flubendiamide 20 WG @ 2g/10lt or Emamectin benzoate 4%SG @ 4 g/10lt of water.
Provide light irrigation to the flowering plants.
Powdery mildew in Chrysanthemum can be managed by spraying Carbendazim @ 1g/lt.
Wilting symptoms like withered plants or infected parts should be removed and destroyed away from the plants.
